payload.name: legal
payload.core: Apply rules to facts, interpret texts, reason from precedents using burdens and standards of proof with adversarial argumentation under institutional constraints.

out.s: claim, supporting rules, factual basis, burden allocation
out.done: position cites applicable authority and meets burden
interpretation addresses ambiguity with precedent or canon

out.s: analogous case, material facts, holding, application

out.done: quantifies exposure range and ranks mitigations

proc: Identify legal question: frame issue precisely, note jurisdiction and applicable body of law
Gather applicable rules: statutes, regulations, contract terms, precedents
Analyze facts: map relevant facts to rule elements, note gaps in evidence
Allocate burden: determine who must prove what and to what standard
Apply rules to facts: step through elements, cite supporting authority
Address counterarguments: anticipate opposing interpretation, distinguish adverse precedent
Assess risk: evaluate likelihood of adverse outcome and exposure magnitude
Recommend action: propose path that balances legal risk with objectives
check: Jurisdiction and choice of law stated
Each rule element mapped to facts or identified as gap

diff.case-based: legal adds formal burdens, standards of proof, and institutional authority
diff.defeasible: legal operates under explicit procedural rules and adversarial structure
diff.hermeneutic: legal interpretation constrained by canons and stare decisis
diff.deontic: legal norms are institutionally enforced; ethics need not be

fail.mode: conflating legal compliance with ethical legitimacy
signals: assumes lawful equals ethical without separate analysis
cites authority without checking current validity

mitigations.test: ethics section present when stakes are high
cite check performed, no overruled cases

rel.how: rules with exceptions and rebuttable presumptions
normative structure of obligations and permissions

confusion.clarify: deontic logic models obligation abstractly; legal reasoning applies institutionally enforced norms with procedural rules
case-based retrieves similar cases; legal reasoning adds stare decisis, burden allocation, and adversarial framing
